### This will create new 300x320 canvas with house and add an attachment house.png.

```
$attachCanvas[mycanvas;house.png]

$fillRect[mycanvas;#03a9f4;130;190;40;60]
$strokeRect[mycanvas;#03a9f4;75;140;150;110]
$createCanvas[mycanvas;300;320]
```

```
$fillRect[mycanvas;#03a9f4;130;190;40;60]
$strokeRect[mycanvas;#03a9f4;75;140;150;110]
$createCanvas[mycanvas;300;320]
```

$alwaysExecute will always emit when a message event is triggered
$and will check if all given conditions are true.

parameters.description: The conditions you want to check.

example:
This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, one condition is `false`.

```js
client.command({
    name: "and",
    code: `
  $and[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: false
});
```

Another example but with it returning true would be:

This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==6.7.0` -> `true`

As you can see, all conditions are `true`.

```js
client.command({
    name: "and",
    code: `
  $and[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==6.7.0]` // returns: true
});
```

description: $cloneEmbed will clone an embed.

parameters.description:
The index of the embed to clone. 
1. **all** 
2. **number**
The ID of the message containing the embed to be cloned.
The ID of the channel where the message is located. Defaults to the current channel.
Whether to return the embed(s) as raw JSON instead of attaching them.

example:
This will clone the previous embed and edit the title after 15 seconds:

```javascript  
client.command({  
    name: "cloneEmbed",  
    code: `  
  $title[Bye!]  
  $cloneEmbed[all;$get[messageID];$channelID]  
  
  $wait[15s]  
  $let[messageID;$sendMessage[{newEmbed: {title:Hello!} {description:I'll edit this message in 15 seconds.}};true]]  
  `  
}); 
``` 

This will return the cloned embed as raw JSON instead of displaying it:

```javascript  
client.command({  
    name: "cloneEmbed",  
    code: `  
  $cloneEmbed[all;$get[messageID];$channelID;true]  
  $let[messageID;$sendMessage[{newEmbed: {title:Data Collected} {description:Storing raw embed JSON.}};true]]  
  `  
});  
```

```js
client.command({
    name: "disableComponents",
    code: `
$disableComponents[$channelID;$get[msgID];button]
$wait[5s]
$let[msgID;$sendMessage[This button will be disabled in 5 seconds.
{actionRow:{button:Button:primary:customID:false}};true]]`
});
```

```js
client.command({
    name: "disableComponents",

$disableComponents[$channelID;$get[msgID]]
$wait[5s]
$let[msgID;$sendMessage[These components will be disabled in 5 seconds. 
{actionRow:{button:Button:primary:customID:false}} 
{actionRow:{selectMenu:MenuCustomID:Placeholder:1:1:false:{stringInput:Option:1:Option Description:false}}};true]]
`
});
```

$elseif is used to create an else statement with condition.
example:
Example usage of `$if: old` (will return "Hello" when the condition is true):

You require `$endelseif` to end the `$elseIf` statement.

```javascript
client.command({
    name: "if",

  $elseif[2==4]
  $endelseif

  `
});
```

description: $humanizeMs will convert MS to human-readable time.
$if will check a condition and return either true or false depending on the condition being true or false.

parameters.description: What to return when the condition is true.
What to return when the condition is false.

example:
This will return `That's false!` as `1` doesn't equal `2`:

```javascript
client.command({
    name: "if",
    code: `
    $if[1==2;That's true!;That's false!]
    `
});
```

This will do the exact same just different usage of `$if` by using `$if: "old"`:

```javascript
client.command({
    name: "if",
    $if: "old",
    code: `
    $if[1==2]
    That's true!
    $else
    That's false!
    $endif
    `
});
```

description: $interactionDefer defers an Interaction of the last 15 minutes.

parameters.description: Visible to the command author only?

example:
```javascript
client.command({
    name: "exampleButton",
    type: "interaction",
    prototype: "button",
    code: `
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the second message!] 
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the first message!] 
   $interactionDefer[true]`
});
```

description: $interactionDeferUpdate defers the interaction message that will be updated.

parameters.description: Visible to the command author only?

example:
```javascript
client.command({
    name: "exampleButton",
    type: "interaction",
    prototype: "button",
    code: ` 
   $interactionFollowUp[This is the first message!]
   $interactionEdit[This is the second message!]
   $interactionDeferUpdate[true]`
});
```

description: $interactionDelete will delete a reply of an interaction.
example:
This will delete the interaction after 5 seconds.

```javascript
module.exports = [
    {
        name: "interactionDelete",
        type: "interaction",
        prototype: "button",
        code: `
  $interactionDelete
  $wait[5s]
  $interactionReply[Hello, World!]
  `
    }
];
```

description: $newApplicationCmd gets the data from application Callbacks (update and create one).
example:
```js
client.applicationCmdUpdateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    Slash command was updated!
- Name: $newApplicationCmd[name]
- ID: $newApplicationCmd[id]
- Application ID: $newApplicationCmd[applicationID]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **slash command is updated** (Modified)

description: $newChannel holds data of the updated channel, used in channel update, delete and create events, or else any data will be empty.
example:
```js
client.channelCreateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    New channel has been created!
- Name: $newChannel[name]
- ID: $newChannel[id]
- <#$newChannel[id]>`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is created**.

---

```js
client.channelDeleteCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    Channel has been deleted!
- Name: $oldChannel[name]
- ID: $oldChannel[id]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is deleted**.

---

```js
client.channelUpdateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    Channel has been updated!
- New name: $newChannel[name]
 - Old name: $oldChannel[name]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is updated**.

---

description: $newEmoji holds data for the emoji after it was updated/ deleted. (emojiUpdate and emojiDelete event)
$newEntitlementData will return the new entitlement data
$newGuild holds data for the guild after the update, might be a good idea to check partial option before accessing any property. (guildUpdate event)
$newMember holds data for the member after the update, might be a good idea to check partial option before accessing any property. (memberUpdate event)
example:
-   **Note: you need `GuildMembers` intent**

```js
client.memberUpdateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their nickname!
- New Nickname: $newMember[nick]
 - Old Nickname: $oldMember[nick]
 
   $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their name!
- New Name: $newMember[name]
 - Old Name: $oldMember[name]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **member updates their guild nickname or Discord username**

```js
- New Name: $newApplicationCmd[name]
 - Old Name: $oldApplicationCmd[name]
- New Description: $newApplicationCmd[description]
 - Old Description: $oldApplicationCmd[description]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **slash command is updated** (Modified)

description: $oldChannel holds data of the channel before it was updated, used in channel update event, or else any data will be empty
example:
```js
client.channelCreateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    New channel has been created!
- Name: $newChannel[name]
- ID: $newChannel[id]
- <#$newChannel[id]>`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is created**.

---

```js
client.channelDeleteCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    Channel has been deleted!
- Name: $oldChannel[name]
- ID: $oldChannel[id]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is deleted**.

---

```js
client.channelUpdateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    Channel has been updated!
- New name: $newChannel[name]
 - Old name: $oldChannel[name]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **channel is updated**.

---

description: $oldEmoji holds data for the emoji before it was updated/ deleted. (emojiUpdate and emojiDelete event)
$oldEntitlementData will return the old entitlement data

$oldGuild holds data for the guild before it was updated, this is from Discord's cache and might be empty depending on whether it's cached, so use partial option before attempting to access any property. (guildUpdate event)

$oldMember holds data for the member before it was updated, this is from Discord's cache and might be empty depending on whether it's cached, so use partial option before attempting to access any property. (memberUpdate event)
example:
-   **Note: You need `GuildMembers` intent**

```js
client.memberUpdateCommand({
    channel: "channelid",
    code: `
    $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their nickname!
- New Nickname: $newMember[nick]
 - Old Nickname: $oldMember[nick]
 
   $username[$newMember[id]] has updated their name!
- New Name: $newMember[name]
 - Old Name: $oldMember[name]`
});
```

-   This code will execute when **member updates their guild nickname or Discord username**

description: $or will check if one of the given conditions is true.

parameters.description: The conditions you want to check.

example:
This will check if the two of three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$authorId` -> `true`
2. `1>=1` -> `true`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, one condition is `false`.

```js
client.command({
    name: "or",
    code: `
  $or[$authorId==$authorId;1>=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: true
});
```

Another example but with it returning false would be:

This will check if the three given conditions are `true`:

1. `$authorId==$channelId` -> `false`
2. `1!=1` -> `false`
3. `$packageVersion==1.0.0` -> `false`

As you can see, all conditions are `false`.

```js
client.command({
    name: "or",
    code: `
  $or[$authorId==$channelId;1!=1;$packageVersion==1.0.0]` // returns: false
});
```

description: $wait will delay functions from executing for a given time.

parameters.description: How long to delay the execution.

example:
This will send an embed with a delay of 5 seconds:

```javascript
client.command({
    name: "wait",
    code: `
    $description[Hello!]
    $wait[5s]
    $sendMessage[Oh, what's that?]
    `
});
```

description: $year will return the current year in CST.
$invite returns information about the invite.
example:
This returns information about the invite.

```javascript
$invite;
```

description: $inviteChannelID returns the ID of the channel the invite is for.
example:
This returns the ID of the channel the invite is for.

```javascript
$inviteChannelID;
```

description: $inviteCode returns the code of the invite.
example:
This returns the code of the invite.

```javascript
$inviteCode;
```

description: $inviteEventInfo returns the inviteSystem event's information
example:
Returns the inviteSystem event's information

```javascript
$inviteEventInfo
//or

$inviteEventInfo[inviter]
//or

$getObjectProperty[name;inviter]
$createObject[name;$inviteEventInfo]
```

description: $inviteGuildID returns the guild ID of the invite.
example:
This returns the guild ID of the invite.

```javascript
$inviteGuildID;
```

description: $inviteJoins returns the member ids who joined with the invite
example:
Returns the member ids who joined with the invite

```javascript
$inviteJoins[inviteCode;$guildID]
```

description: $inviteLeaderboard will return the invite leaderboard.
example:
Returns the invite leaderboard

```javascript
$inviteLeaderboard
//or

$inviteLeaderboard[$guildID;1;10;{position}. {invitername} - {total} invites]
```

description: $inviteMaxUses returns the maximum uses of the invite.
example:
This returns the maximum uses of the invite.

```javascript
$inviteMaxUses;
```

description: $inviteURL returns the URL of the invite.
example:
This returns the URL of the invite.

```javascript
$inviteURL;
```

description: $inviteUserID returns the ID of the user that created the invite.
example:
This returns the ID of the user that created the invite.

```javascript
$inviteUserID;
```

description: $inviteeInfo returns the invitee's information.
example:
Returns the invitee's information

```javascript
$inviteeInfo
//or
$inviteeInfo[$authorID;$guildId;inviter]
//or
$getObjectProperty[name;inviter]
$createObject[name;$inviteeInfo[$authorID;$guildID;all]]
```

description: $inviterInfo will return the inviter's information
example:
Returns the inviter's information

```javascript
$inviterInfo
//or
$inviterInfo[$authorID;$guildId;codes]
//or
$getObjectProperty[name;codes]
$createObject[name;$inviterInfo[$authorID;$guildID;all]]
```

description: $modifyInvite will modify an invite.
example:
Modifies the invite

```javascript
$modifyInvite[$authorID;$guildID;counts.total;10]
```

description: $addFilter will add given filters.

$getFilters will return all active filters.

parameters.description:
become speaker when joining Stage Channel 
1. **yes** (default) 
2. **no**

description: $leaveVC will make your bot leave the current Voice Channel.
$loopMode will either loop the current track, queue or end the loop.

$playPreviousTrack will play the previous track.
$playTrack will play a track using the specified method.

parameters.description:
platform type 
1. **youtube** 
2. **soundcloud** 
3. **spotify** 
4. **local** (local file) 
5. **url** (url which emits music or any other kind)

parameters.description: format to display information about the songs
